definitions.definition: A day of the week except those which form the weekend; that is:
Any day of the week (Monday through Sunday).
On weekdays.
The formal robes of a priest.
A URL presented in canonical form.
Present in a canon, religious or otherwise.
According to recognised or orthodox rules.
definitions.example: The men played golf in the most canonical way, with no local rules.

definitions.definition: Stated or used in the most basic and straightforwardly applicable manner.
definitions.example: the reduction of a linear substitution to its canonical form

definitions.definition: Prototypical.
In conformity with canon law.
In the form of a canon.
Of or pertaining to an ecclesiastical chapter
In canonical form.
Distinguished among entities of its kind, so that it can be picked out in a way that does not depend on any arbitrary choices.
Of or pertaining to a combination of social and political factors.
definitions.example: The socio-political environment in France...

definitions.definition: A surrealist artist
Of, or relating to surrealism

The confinement of people in their own rooms (e.g. in a school) or cells (in a prison), or to their own homes or areas (e.g. in the case of a city- or nation-wide issue) as a security measure after or amid a disturbance or pandemic, etc.
A contrivance to fasten logs together in rafting.
The fur of a mole.
A cotton twill fabric with a heavy velvety nap.
(by extension, in the plural) Clothing made of this fabric.
A padded adhesive bandage used to prevent or treat blisters.
To cover with a moleskin bandage.
A liquid that dissolves a solid, liquid, or gaseous solute, resulting in a solution.
That which resolves.
definitions.example: a solvent of mystery

definitions.definition: Able to pay all debts as they become due, and having no more liabilities than assets.
Having the power of dissolving; causing solution.
A version of football (American football) in which players are touched as opposed to tackled.
A long time (especially a longer time than expected); ages
definitions.example: Haven’t seen him in yonks!

definitions.definition: Someone who aspires to high office, etc.
Seeking advancement.
Striving for recognition.
A company of people that share the same interest or aim.
definitions.example: The Fellowship of the Ring

definitions.definition: Company, companions; a group of people or things following another.
A feeling of friendship, relatedness or connection between people.
A merit-based scholarship.
A temporary position at an academic institution with limited teaching duties and ample time for research; this may also be called a postdoc.
A period of supervised, sub-specialty medical training in the United States and Canada that a physician may undertake after completing a specialty training program or residency.
The proportional division of profit and loss among partners.
To admit to fellowship, enter into fellowship with; to make feel welcome by showing friendship or building a cordial relationship. Now only in religious use.
definitions.example: The Bishop's family fellowshipped the new converts.

definitions.definition: To join in fellowship; to associate with.
definitions.example: After she got married, she stopped fellowshipping with the singles in our church.

definitions.definition: To make something dangerous or toxic by introducing impurities or foreign matter.
definitions.example: This water is contaminated. It isn't safe to drink.

definitions.definition: To soil, stain, corrupt, or infect by contact or association.
To make unfit for use by the introduction of unwholesome or undesirable elements.
definitions.example: Do not contaminate the peanut butter with the jelly.

definitions.definition: To infect, often with bad objects
A building, or a mass of machinery, used to produce refined products such as sugar, oil, or metals.
Having a tint or hue similar to the colour blue.
Somewhat depressed; sad.
A (usually female) street urchin; a homeless girl.
A mischievous, playful, elfish, pert girl or young woman.
(of a girl) Having a boyish, mischievous charm; tomboyish.
A chemical element (symbol Zn) with an atomic number of 30, a slightly brittle blue-silvery metal.
A single atom of this element.
A zinc countertop.
To electroplate with zinc.
To coat with sunblock incorporating zinc oxide.
A stiff or coarse hair.
definitions.example: the bristles of a pig

definitions.definition: The hairs or other filaments that make up a brush, broom, or similar item.
To rise or stand erect, like bristles.
Abound, to have an abundance of something
(with at) To be on one's guard or raise one's defenses; to react with fear, suspicion, or distance.
definitions.example: The employees bristled at the prospect of working through the holidays.

definitions.definition: To fix a bristle to.
definitions.example: to bristle a thread

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to meteorology.
definitions.example: The trip was postponed because the meteorological conditions were so bad.

definitions.definition: An official keeper or recorder of records.
An officer in a university who keeps enrollment and academic achievement records.
A doctor receiving advanced specialist training in some countries in order to become a consultant.
A service that manages domain names.

(grammar, narrow sense) A word that can be used to refer to a person, animal, place, thing, phenomenon, substance, quality, or idea; one of the basic parts of speech in many languages, including English.

(grammar, now rare, broad sense) Either a word that can be used to refer to a person, animal, place, thing, phenomenon, substance, quality or idea, or a word that modifies or describes a previous word or its referent; a substantive or adjective, sometimes also including other parts of speech such as numeral or pronoun.
To convert a word to a noun.
A set of policies or programs providing advantages for people of a group who are seen to have traditionally been discriminated against.
A specific policy with such a goal.
One who is versed in anthropology.
An intentional interference with another's property or person.
Sin
To commit an offence; to sin.
To offend against, to wrong (someone).
To go too far; to put someone to inconvenience by demand or importunity; to intrude.
definitions.example: to trespass upon the time or patience of another

definitions.definition: To enter someone else's property illegally.
To pass beyond a limit or boundary; hence, to depart; to go.
To decree that a person shall be arrested for trespassing if he or she returns to someone else's land.
definitions.example: The dean trespassed the streaker from his university.

definitions.definition: An approach shot made from a location a short distance from the golf green in which the ball is launched into the air with only low or moderate force, so that it will land on the green and roll toward the hole.
A relatively easy field goal, made from a short distance.

A shot in which the ball is kicked from underneath with accuracy but with less than maximum force, to launch it high into the air in order either to pass it over the heads of opponents or to score a goal.
A takeout shot aimed at hitting a rock at an angle.

The achievement of a goal or the striking of a target with a ball or other projectile in relatively nonchallenging or routine circumstances, by throwing (as in basketball) or by discharging a firearm (as in hunting).
(by extension) Something that is easy to do or to achieve.
Assistant waiter; one who clears plates from and cleans tables
(often with up) To make or become sober.
(often with up) To overcome or lose a state of intoxication.
definitions.example: It took him hours to sober up.

definitions.definition: To moderate one's feelings
Not drunk; not intoxicated
Not given to excessive drinking of alcohol
definitions.example: 1890, John Charles, The Godly, Righteous, And Sober Life

definitions.definition: Moderate; realistic; serious; not playful; not passionate; cool; self-controlled
Dull; not bright or colorful
Subdued; solemn; grave
Poor; feeble
Thin, malnourished and weak.
Feeling or causing joy.
A diviner who foretells events by the behaviour of birds or other animals, or by signs derived from celestial phenomena, or unusual occurrences.
An official who interpreted omens before the start of public events.
To foretell events; to exhibit signs of future events.
To anticipate, to foretell, or to indicate a favorable or an unfavorable issue.
definitions.example: to augur well or ill

definitions.definition: To make such a sound.
A bleating sound, as that of a sheep or goat.
A person belonging to two races.
Of or pertaining to two races
Having parents of two races
A person who is being mentored

A musical wind instrument of Celtic origin, possessing a flexible bag inflated by bellows, a double-reed melody pipe and up to four drone pipes; any aerophone that produces sound using air from a reservoir to vibrate enclosed reeds.
definitions.example: Bagpipes are traditionally played in most Celtic regions and many former parts of the British Empire.

definitions.definition: Causing bother or perplexity.
A long mound of earth, stone, or similar material, usually built for purposes such as to hold back or store water, for protection from weather or enemies, or to support a road or railway.
An Asian plant, Solanum melongena, cultivated for its edible purple, green, or white ovoid fruit
The fruit of this plant, eaten as a vegetable
A dark purple colour; eggplant.
New cocoyam: Xanthosoma, particularly Xanthosoma sagittifolium, or the edible root of that plant; malanga.
Old cocoyam: Colocasia esculenta; taro.
Doctrine of preordination; doctrine of absolute decrees; doctrine that God acts in an absolute manner.
The principles or practice of absolute or arbitrary government; despotism.
Belief in a metaphysical absolute; belief in Absolute.
Positiveness; the state of being absolute.
The characteristic of being absolute in nature or scope; absoluteness.
A sudden or unexpected event in a play, pulled off by the author, the director, or even an actor.
A theatrical trick or gesture, something staged for dramatic effect.
Having qualities resembling those of steel, especially hard and resolute.
definitions.example: The bully backed down before his steely gaze.

definitions.definition: Made of steel.
To cause to feel extreme apprehension or unease; to cause to experience horror.
definitions.example: The haunted house was horrifying, from one room to the next I felt more and more like I wasn’t going to survive.

definitions.definition: Tending to inspire horror; that horrifies; horrific.
To adapt a literary work so that it can be performed in the theatre, or on radio or television
To present something in a dramatic or melodramatic manner
Able to be operated or used
Able to be put into operation; practicable
Able to be treated by surgery
A brief and simple sales pitch; a short summary of a business plan, process, or product, and its selling point and value proposition.
A passenger train that stops at most, if not all, of the stations on the route in the course of its journey.
A bicycle with no suspension system.
Stiff, rather than flexible.
Fixed, rather than moving.
Rigorous and unbending.
Uncompromising.

Any one of the numerous species of birds belonging to several genera within the family Corvidae, including Garrulus, Cyanocitta, Aphelocoma, Perisoreus, Cyanocorax, Gymnorhinus, Cyanolyca, Ptilostomus, and Calocitta, allied to the crows, but smaller, more graceful in form, often handsomely coloured, usually having a crest, and often noisy.
Other birds of similar appearance and behaviour.
Any of various large papilionid butterflies of the genus Graphium.
A dull or ignorant person. It survives today in the term jaywalking.
Promiscuous woman; prostitute.
The name of the Latin-script letter J.
A marijuana cigarette; a joint.
Ill-tempered or annoyed.
A weekend and holiday residence, located outside of urban areas, used as a retreat from city life.
A second home.
Willful damage to or destruction of any property, such as graffiti or defacement.
definitions.example: As we turned down the street I was appalled by the vandalism: spray paint and smashed windows that were everywhere.

definitions.definition: A metal that is a combination of two or more elements, at least one of which is a metal.
A metal of lesser value, mixed with a metal of greater value.
definitions.example: gold without alloy

definitions.definition: An admixture; something added which stains, taints etc.
Fusion, marriage, combination.
To mix or combine; often used of metals.
To reduce the purity of by mixing with a less valuable substance.
definitions.example: to alloy gold with silver or copper, or silver with copper

definitions.definition: To impair or debase by mixture.
definitions.example: to alloy pleasure with misfortunes

definitions.definition: To display, to have somebody see (something).
definitions.example: All he had to show for four years of attendance at college was a framed piece of paper.

definitions.definition: To bestow; to confer.
To indicate (a fact) to be true; to demonstrate.
To guide or escort.
definitions.example: Could you please show him on his way. He has overstayed his welcome.

definitions.definition: To be visible; to be seen; to appear.
definitions.example: At length, his gloom showed.

definitions.definition: To put in an appearance; show up.
definitions.example: We waited for an hour, but they never showed.

definitions.definition: To have an enlarged belly and thus be recognizable as pregnant.
(racing) To finish third, especially of horses or dogs.
definitions.example: In the third race: Aces Up won, paying eight dollars; Blarney Stone placed, paying three dollars; and Cinnamon showed, paying five dollars.

definitions.definition: To have a certain appearance, such as well or ill, fit or unfit; to become or suit; to appear.
An occasion when something is shown.
definitions.example: We went to the midnight showing of the new horror movie.

definitions.definition: A result, a judgement.
definitions.example: He made a poor showing at his first time at bat.

definitions.definition: The act of pulling something along a surface using motive power.
The condition of being so pulled.
Grip.
The pulling power of an engine or animal.
The adhesive friction of a wheel etc on a surface.
(usually after forms of gain, get or have) Progress in or momentum toward achieving a goal.
A mechanically applied sustained pull, especially to a limb.
Collectively, the locomotives of a railroad, especially electric locomotives.
To apply a sustained pull to (a limb, etc.).
The state of being mature, ready or ripe.
definitions.example: Some foods and drinks, like wine, only reach their full taste at maturity, which literally comes at a price

definitions.definition: When bodily growth has completed and/or reproduction can begin.
The state of a debt obligation at the end of the term of maturation thereof, once all interest and any applicable fees have accrued to the principal.
Date when payment is due.
definitions.example: The note was cashed at maturity.

definitions.definition: Any of many games of strategy or chance played on a specially designed board; often involves one or more players moving pieces and using dice or cards.
That which is vain, futile, or worthless; that which is of no value, use or profit.
Excessive pride in or admiration of one's own abilities, appearance or achievements.

A dressing table used to apply makeup, preen, and coif hair. The table is normally quite low and similar to a desk, with drawers and one or more mirrors on top. Either a chair or bench is used to sit upon.
A washbasin installed into a permanently fixed storage unit, used as an item of bathroom furniture.
Emptiness.
Any idea, theory or statement that is without foundation.
definitions.example: It is a vanity to say that if two stones are dropped from a tower, the heavier will experience the greater acceleration.

definitions.definition: Art, decorative objects and other forms of representation of questionable artistic or aesthetic value; a representation that is excessively sentimental, overdone, or vulgar.
Of art and decor: of questionable aesthetic value; excessively sentimental, overdone or vulgar.
In a deplorable state.
Filled with or deeply affected by woe.
Corn (specifically maize) suitable for eating by humans, as distinguished from corn raised as animal feed.
Fear of, dislike of or prejudice against homosexuals.
(individual occurrences) A pathological fear of mankind.
One of various species of grass of the genus Cymbopogon, especially Cymbopogon citratus, which have a lemon-like taste and aroma, and are used in cooking, for tea, and for fragrance.
Sourgrass, Oxalis pes-caprae.
An independent publisher.
A work released by an independent publisher.
A type of rock music, generally soft-style without screaming or aggression, mixed with synthesized music and electronic.
A person who listens to indie music and follows indie fashion.
Independent; from outside the mainstream.
definitions.example: an indie pop group

definitions.definition: A tape measure.
Exile, banish, remove, or send away.
(in extended use) Consign or assign.
Refer or submit.
(history) A person who has been banished from proximity to Rome for a set time, but without losing his civil rights.
Relegated; exiled.
The state or feeling of being empty.
The sport of riding on water skis, whilst being towed by a motorboat.
To reduce the price of.
To write a memorandum about.
To subtract marks or points from, for an error.
definitions.example: The writing is good, but I had to mark you down for failing to cite references.

definitions.definition: To write down.
To draw a conclusion about something; to consider something to be a certain way. (Typically used with as.)
A cool, refreshing state of the air; coolness, duskiness, shade.
An artwork made by applying water-based pigment to wet or fresh lime mortar or plaster.
The technique used to make such an artwork.
To paint using fresco.
The state of being self-confident
A measure of one's belief in one's own abilities
To feel resentment over; to consider as an affront.
definitions.example: The bride greatly resented being left at the church.

definitions.definition: To express displeasure or indignation at.
To be sensible of; to feel.
In a positive sense, to take well; to receive with satisfaction.
To recognize; to perceive, especially as if by smelling; -- associated in meaning with sent, the older spelling of scent, to smell. See resent (intransitive verb).
To give forth an odor; to smell; to savor.
To send again.
definitions.example: I didn't get your email. You'll have to resend it.

definitions.definition: To send back.
To forward (something received), especially a message.
A newspaper having pages half the dimensions of the standard format.
A newspaper, especially one in this format, that favours stories of a sensational or even fictitious nature over serious news.
A compressed portion of drugs, chemicals, etc.; a tablet.
In the format of a tabloid.
Relating to a tabloid or tabloids.
definitions.example: tabloid journalism

definitions.definition: To give birth to a calf
To assist in a cow's giving birth to a calf
To give birth to (a calf)
(especially of an ice shelf, a glacier, an ice sheet, or even an iceberg) to shed a large piece, e.g. an iceberg or a smaller block of ice (coming off an iceberg)
definitions.example: The glacier was starting to calve even as we watched.

definitions.definition: (especially of an iceberg) to break off
definitions.example: The sea was dangerous because of icebergs calving off the nearby glacier.

definitions.definition: (especially of an ice shelf, a glacier, an ice sheet, or even an iceberg) to shed (a large piece, e.g. an iceberg); to set loose (a mass of ice), e.g. a block of ice (coming off an iceberg)
definitions.example: The glacier was starting to calve an iceberg even as we watched.

definitions.definition: A type of savoury cake, typically flat and round, made from batter and yeast, containing many small holes and served toasted, usually with butter.
A person (or, collectively, persons), usually female, considered sexually desirable.
definitions.example: John and his mates have gone out to find themselves some crumpet.

definitions.definition: A native or inhabitant of the Caucasus.
A member of the Caucasian racial classification described above.
A white person.
A group of languages spoken in the Caucasus area.
(bartending) The White Russian, a cocktail consisting of coffee liqueur, vodka, and milk. Made popular by the 1998 film The Big Lebowski.
Of, or relating to the Caucasus region or its people, languages and culture.

Of a racial classification; pertaining to people having certain phenotypical features such as straight, wavy or curly hair and very light to brown pigmented skin, and originating from Europe, parts of Northern Africa and Western, Central and South Asia.
(of a person) White, being a white person.
Protective eyewear set in a flexible frame to fit snugly against the face.
definitions.example: Goggles must be worn in the swimming pool.

definitions.definition: Blinds for shying horses.
A wide-eyed stare or affected rolling of the eye.
(in the plural) A pair of protective eyeglasses.
To stare (at something) with wide eyes.
To roll the eyes.
